members.name: ConductanceScalingUpdateInterval

custom_methods.name: EstimateOptimalTimeStep
custom_methods.doc: This method autmatically  sets the optimal timestep for an image given its spacing.
custom_methods.body:
std::vector<double> spacing = inImage.GetSpacing();
double minSpacing = *std::min_element( spacing.begin(), spacing.end()); this->m_TimeStep = minSpacing / std::pow(2.0, static_cast< double >( inImage.GetDimension() ) ); return this->m_TimeStep;

tests.description: Change number of iterations and timestep

briefdescription: This filter performs anisotropic diffusion on a scalar itk::Image using the classic Perona-Malik, gradient magnitude based equation.
detaileddescription:
For detailed information on anisotropic diffusion, see itkAnisotropicDiffusionFunction and itkGradientNDAnisotropicDiffusionFunction.

\par Inputs and Outputs
The input to this filter should be a scalar itk::Image of any dimensionality. The output image will be a diffused copy of the input.


\par Parameters
Please see the description of parameters given in itkAnisotropicDiffusionImageFilter.


\see AnisotropicDiffusionImageFilter 


\see AnisotropicDiffusionFunction 


\see GradientAnisotropicDiffusionFunction
